availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Margaret Haynes Davis in Grainger County, Tennessee, in October 1851. Father of Nancy Davis, John Davis, Isaac Davis, Nathan Davis, James Davis, Daniel Davis, Elijah Davis, Rebecca H. Davis, and Margaret J. Davis. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Grainger County, District 14, p.116A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 3, p. 437.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 3, p. 221B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Grainger County Marriages, 1850-1859.
"William Davis (1811-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial #11861097, accessed September 27, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/11861097.
